oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Enantioselective synthesis of gamma-tetrasubstituted nitrosulfonyl carboxylates and amides via L-tert-leucine-derived-squaramide catalyzed conjugate addition of nitrosulfones to acrylates and acrylamides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BERA, K
NAMBOOTHIRI, INN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MATRIX-METALLOPROTEINASE INHIBITORS
ALPHA-KETO ESTERS
MICHAEL-ADDITION
VINYL SULFONES
ALPHA,BETA-UNSATURATED ALDEHYDES
ORGANOCATALYTIC ADDITION
ASYMMETRIC CATALYSIS
CHIRAL SQUARAMIDES
1,3-DIPOLAR CYCLOADDITION
AMINO-ACIDS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Michael addition of alpha-nitrosulfones to aryl-and alkyl acrylates and acrylamides proceeds in the presence of 5-10 mol% of an amino acid derived new organocatalyst to provide gamma-tetrasubstituted gamma-nitro-gamma-sulfonyl carboxylates and amides in excellent yields and enantioselectivities. Scale-up of the reaction to multi-grams, convenient recovery of the catalyst and its recyclability without any drop in yield and selectivity are attractive features of this methodology.
